section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. <*$p$*> The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience.
explanation: The first sentence states the customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fee, implying an obligation. The second sentence then states the customer pays at their 'discretion and convenience,' which contradicts the idea of a required payment. This creates ambiguity.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. <*$p$*> Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon fifteen (15) days' written notice.
explanation: The first sentence describes the agreement's automatic renewal for 'one (1) or more one (1) month periods' if no notice is given. However, the subsequent sentence allows either party to terminate the agreement 'at any time' with fifteen (15) days' notice. This presents a contradiction: the agreement can automatically renew, but can also be terminated at any point, even during a renewed month, with just fifteen days' notice. This creates uncertainty about the length of commitment.

section: i-on will be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages. <*$p$*> i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.
explanation: The first sentence states i-on will NOT be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages. The second sentence contradicts the first sentence as it states i-on's liability for damages to the customer shall be limited to one month's fees. This presents a contradiction because it is stating the conditions of liability in the second sentence, while declaring that it won't be liable in the first.
